fields.name: identifier
fields.description: Identifier(s) by which this location is known.

fields.name: identifier.type
fields.description: The type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

binding.description: The type used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

fields.name: physicalType
fields.description: Physical form of the location, e.g. building, room, vehicle, road.

fields.name: extension[x].extension[x].valueCodeableConcept
fields.description: The value of the client defined custom attribute. This extension is nested under a custom-attribute extension.

binding.description: The value of the client defined custom attribute. This binding is used for the custom-attribute-value extension nested under custom-attribute extensions.
binding.note:
• The terminology binding only applies when the custom-attribute-value extension is of type CodeableConcept.
  • The value of the custom attribute is not limited to a single Code Set or nomenclature.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status property covers the general availability of the resource, not the current value which may be covered by the operationStatus, or by a schedule/slots if they are configured for the location.

fields.name: mode
fields.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.

binding.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.

fields.name: telecom
fields.description: The contact details of communication devices available at the location. This can include phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.

binding.description: The contact details of communication devices available at the location. This can include phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Indicates the type of function performed at the location.

binding.description: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.
